definitions: Past tense of burn: to be on fire or to cause something to be on fire.
Past tense of burn: to be damaged, destroyed, or injured by fire or heat.
Past tense of burn: to use fuel or energy.
Past tense of burn: to feel very hot or to cause a hot sensation.
examples: The house burned to the ground.
She burned her hand on the stove.
The engine burned a lot of oil.
